justification: Participants "rate[d] the faces ... from 0 (strongly disagree) to 4 (strongly agree) if they thought the individual shown looked friendly".
The rating procedure asked whether the person "looked warm" on the same 0–4 scale.
Faces were rated on trustworthiness: "rate[d] ... if they thought the individual shown looked ... trustworthy" (0–4 scale).

measured_by: 0–4 Likert face-rating item "would like to socialize with"
justification: Participants indicated how much they "would like to socialize with the individual shown" using the 0–4 rating scale.
construct: Desire to socialize with the person

measured_by: 0–4 Likert face-rating item "looks good at solving problems"
justification: The rating list included whether "the individual looked like they were good at solving problems," rated 0–4.
construct: Perceived problem-solving ability of a face

measured_by: Two-arm bandit task with abstract symbols -> smiling/neutral face outcomes
justification: Participants "performed a two-arm bandit task, in which they were instructed to try to learn the actions that would make the two individuals ... happy," allowing assessment of learning accuracy.

measured_by: Extinction preference task (choice between previously learned symbols without feedback)
justification: "Following the two-arm bandit task, participants were presented with pairs of the abstract symbols, and instructed to choose between them ... No feedback was provided during this preference task," which measured their action preferences after outcome devaluation.
construct: Outcome-based action preference / model-based decision making
